LanguageData.EmpathyChangesTooltip: Turn this off to restore colonists' reactions to bad things happening to other people to normal. This will increase difficulty; Bleeding Heart pawns will be unaffected. Restart the game after disabling this.
LanguageData.SexualityChangesTooltip: Turn this off to disable Kinsey scaling of pawns and re-enable the Gay trait. Do NOT change this during play, and restart the game after toggling this.
LanguageData.KinseyModeTooltip: This setting determines what formula is used to weight the Kinsey scale when pawns are generated.
LanguageData.KWTooltip: When custom mode is enabled, this sets the relative weight for {0} on the Kinsey scale for generated pawns.
LanguageData.IndividualityTooltip: Turn this off to disable the negative thought your colonists will get if they are wearing perfectly matching outfits with other colonists. This thought adds extra difficulty, so it's optional, but recommended.
LanguageData.ElectionsTooltip: Turn this off to prevent your colonists from having yearly elections for leaders. This will not affect compatibility with other mods.
LanguageData.DurationTooltip: Set how long people will remember conversations for. The default is 60 days, i.e. one year. The minimum is 15 day, one quadrum, and the maximum is 180 days, three years. Setting it lower will make colonists' interactions with each other more ephemeral, and setting it higher will make them more lasting.
LanguageData.SendDateLettersTooltip: Turn this off to disable receiving letters when your colonists plan a date together.
LanguageData.BenchmarkingTooltip: Turn this on to receive occasional performance reports in the console relating to Psychology systems. You can copy and paste these reports to assist in optimization of the mod. WARNING: Performance testing comes with its own performance impact.\n\nToggling this will restart your game.
LanguageData.ImprisonedTooltip: Enable/disable negative opinion penalty for recruited prisoners (-40 Faction imprisoned me).
LanguageData.RomanceMultiplierTooltip: Romance chance will be multiplied by this value. Setting to 0 should eliminate romance entirely.
LanguageData.RomanceChanceThresholdTooltip: Minimum opinion one colonist must have of another in order to be romanced.
LanguageData.MayorAgeTooltip: Age required for someone to be able to become a mayor.
LanguageData.AllowAnxietyTooltip: Allow colonists to get anxiety after mental breaks (chance depends on colonist's psyche and mental breaks severity). Note that you might still see it as random disease.
LanguageData.TraitOpinionMultiplierTooltip: Scale the opinion changes from the following traits: \n\n Pretty, Ugly, Disfigured, Annoying voice, Creepy breathing, Body modder appreciation, and Body purist disgust.
LanguageData.DisplayOptionsTooltip: Change the default display option for the Psyche tab.
LanguageData.UseColorsTooltip: Colorize traits displayed in the Psyche tab.
LanguageData.ListAlphabeticalTooltip: List the traits alphabetically in the Psyche tab.
LanguageData.UseAntonymsTooltip: Use trait antonyms in the Psyche tab.
LanguageData.EnablePsycheTooltip: Turn this off to deactivate personality. This is recommended for non-sapient species such as simple robots that lack the capacity for complex thoughts and emotions. Warning: conversations and romance will be disabled for this species.
LanguageData.EnableAgeGapTooltip: Turn this off to deactivate the romantic age gap preference for pawns romancing this species. This is recommended for elf-like species that do not experience senescence and/or remain equally attractive regardless of age once they reach adulthood.
LanguageData.MinDatingAgeTooltip: Set the minimum dating age for this species. When positive, the effective age for dating-related formulas scales by this number relative to 14. Setting this to 0 allows dating at any age and effectively disables the age gap. This is recommended for sapient species such as androids with no childhood phase. Any negative number disables dating completely for this species.
LanguageData.MinLovinAgeTooltip: Set the minimum lovin age for this species. When positive, the effective age for lovin-related formulas scales by this number relative to 16. Setting this to 0 allows lovin at any age and effectively disables the age gap. This is recommended for sapient species such as androids with no childhood phase. Any negative number disables lovin completely for this species.
